Statement of Objectives: a one-to-two-page typed statement addressing the question, 'Why do I want to become a health educator?'
Initial Teacher Certification in another subject area is required.
Interview with graduate program coordinator.
column38: School of Education, Health & Human Services
column47: Our Master of Science in Education in School Health Education prepares students for advanced-level careers in school health education. The program leads to professional certification for teaching health in New York State public schools. This program provides students who possess an initial teaching certificate in health with the graduate coursework necessary to earn professional teaching certification in New York State. Candidates who do not possess initial certification in health education may earn it by combining this program with the health education certification program.

column2: Master of Social Work
column16:
A baccalaureate degree from an accredited college or university.
A minimum undergraduate GPA of 3.0 (on a 4.0 scale).
A liberal arts foundation with a minimum of 12 credits in the social sciences, 6 credits in the humanities and 3 credits in the biological sciences with a grade of 'C' or better.
Relevant human services experience (volunteer or paid) is strongly recommended for all applicants, and may be required of applicants with GPAs below a 3.25.
Students applying for advanced standing must have a BSW from a CSWE-accredited program earned within the last six years and a minimum 3.25 GPA in their social work major.
column38: School of Arts & Sciences
column46: Practice with children and families, Practice with older adults and their families
column47: The Master of Social Work (MSW) program at SUNY Brockport is designed for students who are committed to social justice and to serving oppressed and disadvantaged populations. It prepares students for advanced social work practice. We are the largest MSW program in the Rochester area. Our MSW program boasts a diverse student body, an outstanding faculty, a variety of exciting field placement opportunities, a student-centered approach to learning, and a rigorous curriculum designed to help students acquire the skills necessary for effective social work practice.
column50: The Master of Social Work program at SUNY Brockport is accredited by the Council on Social Work Education (CSWE).

column2: Teacher Leader (Advanced Certificate)
column38: School of Education, Health & Human Services
column40: $5,655 per semester for NYS residents; $11,550 per semester for out-of-state residents. (Full-time, 9+ credits). Annual cost for NYS resident is $11,310.
column47: The Teacher Leader Program at SUNY Brockport is designed for practicing teachers who want to expand their professional impact beyond the classroom without leaving the classroom. The curriculum is intended to complement their existing teaching practices, not replace them. In fact, many of the projects in the program can be implemented in the candidate’s own classroom and school.
column50: The Teacher Leader program is a registered program through the New York State Education Department.
column52: $471 for NYS residents, $963 for out-of-state residents

column2: Master of Science in Education in Teaching English to Speakers of Other Languages
column38: School of Education, Health and Human Services
column47: Teach English to speakers of other languages, and open yourself up to a world of opportunity. The Master of Science in Education in Teaching English to Speakers of Other Languages (TESOL) is for students who have a passion for other cultures and want to help non-native English speakers learn the English language. This 30-36 credit program will lead to an initial and/or professional certification in TESOL for pre-K-12 students. We also offer a non-certification track for those who wish to teach English to adult learners or in other settings that do not require NYS certification.
column50: All teacher preparation programs are accredited by the Council for the Accreditation of Educator Preparation (CAEP).
column99: The Diversity Fellowship provides an annual stipend of $10,000 and a full tuition scholarship.

column2: Advanced Certificate in Teaching English to Speakers of Other Languages
column38: School of Education, Health & Human Services
column47:
The Advanced Certificate in TESOL is intended for graduate students who already hold a master’s degree but wish to complete the requirements for New York State certification in English to Speakers of Other Languages (ESOL).

The program is 100% online, and can be completed by a full-time student in as few as three semesters. The Advanced Certificate program in TESOL (Teaching English to Speakers of other Languages) is approved by the New York State Education Department for teacher certification, and completion of the program leads to a recommendation for certification for those who meet all requirements.

The department is accredited by the Council for the Accreditation of Educator Preparation (CAEP). The Department of Education and Human Development has an excellent faculty who are well known in their fields and are highly respected for their scholarship, teaching, and service.

Students who complete the Advanced Certificate program in TESOL will be prepared to assist school districts in applying for ESOL teacher certification from the New York State Education Department.
column50: The Advanced Certificate program in TESOL (Teaching English to Speakers of other Languages) is approved by the New York State Education Department for teacher certification...The department is accredited by the Council for the Accreditation of Educator Preparation (CAEP).

column2: Women & Gender Studies (Advanced Certificate)
column38: School of Arts and Sciences
column47:
The Advanced Certificate in Women & Gender Studies (WMS) is a 12-credit program that addresses historical and contemporary issues of women, gender, and sexuality from an interdisciplinary perspective. All students take WMS 601 Feminist Principles and WMS 602 Global Feminisms. You can complete the remainder of the program by taking nine credits of designated courses that deal with women, gender, and sexuality in different fields. Some of the many options include courses in Anthropology, Communication, Counselor Education, English, History, Public Administration, and Sociology. This certificate helps graduate students to broaden their knowledge in the exciting field of women and gender studies, and enhance their career opportunities.

The Advanced Certificate in Women & Gender Studies helps students to think critically about the ways that gender and sexuality shape our experiences. This certificate is valuable to students in a number of master’s programs, including history, English, public administration, and mental health counseling. It is also a good choice for people who work in human services, non-profit organizations, and education, who want to enhance their professional credentials.
column99: Up to full tuition + $10,000 stipend
